subject: domain1.com
recommended_action: Configure Cloudflare to proxy the DNS record. By setting up Cloudflare as your hostname's reverse proxy, Cloudflare protects origin servers from DDoS attacks by hiding their IP addresses. You can configure Cloudflare to proxy your hostname in your DNS settings.

subject: domain3.com
insight: Security.txt not configured. Configure and manage the Security.txt file to improve the website's vulnerability disclosure process
detection_method: We evaluated the Security Settings configured for this domain and found that Security.txt is not enabled.
risk: The absence of Security.txt insights creates a lack of a clear, accessible method for researchers to report vulnerabilities. This can lead to security issues going unnoticed or under-reported, increasing the risk of exploitation.

subject: domain12.com
insight: Unproxied CNAME Records. This DNS record is not proxied by Cloudflare. Your origin server is directly exposed and has a higher risk of a DDoS attack.
detection_method: We reviewed your Cloudflare DNS settings and checked whether your hostname accepts connections on either port 80 or 443.
recommended_action: Configure Cloudflare to proxy the DNS record. By setting up Cloudflare as your hostname's reverse proxy, Cloudflare protects origin servers from DDoS attacks by hiding their IP addresses. You can configure Cloudflare to proxy your hostname in your DNS settings.

subject: domain14.com
insight: Managed Rules not deployed. We have detected that you have not enabled the Cloudflare Managed Rules feature on your zone.
detection_method: We evaluated your websites and you have no Managed Rules deployed.
risk: Insufficient protection for vulnerabilities targeting Web and API applications
recommended_action: Turn on Managed Rules. Deploy Cloudflare Managed Rules on your zone to protect your web application against common vulnerabilities in web applications.
